comment.author: 32921850@N00
comment._content: Killed on your birthday. No one can really imagine the true lows of war.

comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content:
Captain Henry Charles Willders-Lewis was the son of Nora Willders-Lewis of "Penshurst", 57 Waddon Park Avenue, Croydon, Surrey, and the late Henry Willders- Lewis.

He was Commissioned into the Queen's (Royal West Surrey) Regiment on 26th September 1916 as a temporary 2nd Lieutenant on Probation [London Gazette 17 Oct 1916].  That he was a Temporary Captain just 10 months later reflects the casualties suffered by his Battalion. 

He was killed in action at Zillebeke while temporarily commanding "A" Company.//

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: 31 July 1917 was the first day of the third battle of Ypres.
